meanings.definition: The gullet or esophagus of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The weasands of the cow help it swallow food.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian checked the weasands of the dog during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The weasands of the snake must be clear for it to eat its prey.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as smooth as silk, sliding down his weasands effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The weasands of the whale allow it to filter krill from the water.

meanings.definition: A tube or passage for air or liquid, especially in the throat.
meanings.sent1: The weasands of the fish help it breathe underwater.
meanings.sent2: When she choked on the water, it went down the wrong weasands.
meanings.sent3: He laughed so hard that soda came out of his weasands.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed through her weasands, calming her nerves.
meanings.sent5: The weasands of the plant allow it to absorb nutrients from the soil.
